articles.author: Brandon Sapienza
articles.title: EU regulators say Pfizer vaccine can be kept in the fridge for longer - Yahoo News
articles.description: On Monday, the European Medicines Agency said that unopened and thawed vials of the Pfizer vaccine can be kept in the fridge for a month. The previous regulation had the vaccine limited to just five days in the cold conditions.

articles.title: AfDB, European bank to bridge $2.5tn Africa's financing gap - The Punch

articles.author: Antony Thrower
articles.title: EU is set to agree to allow in British tourists who can prove they've had Covid jabs - Daily Mail
articles.description: The EU is expected to sign off on plans for people from Britain who have had both jabs to fly anywhere in Europe without having to quarantine on their arrival or show a negative Covid test.
articles.content:
The EU is expected to sign off on plans for Britons who have had both jabs to fly to Europe without having to quarantine or take a Covid test.

articles.title: Soccer-Kane tells Spurs he wants to leave club before Euros - Sky Sports - The Star Online
articles.description: (Reuters) -     Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane has informed the Premier League club of his desire to leave this summer, with the England international looking to resolve his future before next month's European Championship, Sky Sports reported on Monday.

articles.title: Tanaiste Leo Varadkar says foreign holidays won't be allowed until August - Irish Mirror
articles.description: EU Green Cert opening up travel across Europe comes in next month, but Tánaiste says we won't implement it until August
articles.content:
Leo Varadkar wants nobody to holiday abroad until at least August.
